U87M1BMb5zZjBTIoye-Jzw.text: I went on a business meal for lunch around noon and it was busy and relatively loud. Didn't have to wait long and food came quickly. One of the best Viva Chicken locations!

TZn1wJlugsep_ixgEmplsQ.text: This is such a GREAT addition to this area. I have ordered at the Johnson Rd location many times and been very happy with the food. Tonight was my first experience with the Waverley location and I have to say that I was blown away with how friendly and professional the young staff were. You've done a great job training this crew. Congratulations. If you haven't been there yet get there! All of the food is excellent.

219CQm7c-huVdWu6M9A8Pg.text: Really awesome Peruvian food.  Incredible flavors, outstanding sauces!!  Best thing on the menu is the Saltado!!  Can't go wrong at any of them!!  Sometimes can be crowded so beware of the lines

FMnDixL3ZLqbDCGkAWuKAQ.text: Nicest staff ever!! Customer Service is a 10! Food is also equally delicious. Favorite location hands down.

Uto3eOqdl4cX8zmfOmMpUg.text: I had never been to viva chicken before until a couple days ago and it was awesome! Some people had told me it was just like chipotle but I disagree. I I thought it was way better than chipotle. There menu items were very good looking and I will definitely be back for more.

rXjNAthu23CvTclUb33WPw.text: This is a great spot to eat if you are going low carb or are eating gluten free-ish. Nothing here can be certified gluten free, but it's easy to avoid. We had a 1/2 chicken with green beans and a house salad, and a 1/4 chicken with green beans and rice. It was all delicious and fresh. We dined in, and while it took a bit to be served, it wasn't horribly long. The reason for the three stars is the service and atmosphere. The server brought the order and my meal was wrong. She did take the plate away but didn't say anything to me and it took longer to replace than we expected. My companions meal was almost cold by the time I was served the right meal.  This location had only been open for a day, and I think every Viva Chicken manager within a 500 mile radius was there. It was interesting none were female. The amount of Bro Bonding going on behind me, to the side of me and in front of me was ridiculous and distracting. One guy even had his fly open. Slightly disturbing while trying to eat after seeing that. Don't get me wrong here. The food is great. The service was not, and the manager meet ups going on all around us for our entire ruined it for us.

5q-47pMUEr-HTsfKTZ-iLg.text: Viva Chicken is consistently fantastic at each location. We are so thankful that the Waverly restaurant is open. Everything is great on the menu and allergy friendly. So many options and fantastic service!  If you need a quick bite and don't want to sacrifice quality you should definitely try them out.

mt6IfOXUscMQwPoyumUtkQ.text: Great food, but "club" music is waaay too loud. Hopefully, that is only because they just opened.  I had the stuffed avocado and it was fresh and delicious. My husband had a sandwich and the bread was warm and fresh and the cilantro rice was great!

cCYrXOAtiPgUQqn0LaJQnw.text: Service wasn't great, when we ordered I guess they forgot to give us a number so when the guy came out to give the food he told us it wasn't ours even though it was (he didn't speak great english either) There seems to be a lot of staff hanging around as well, like they had too many people working that shift. Food is OK, I got the Amazon Caesar and they forgot to give me my dressing for it, even though the place was mostly empty. My mom loved her rice bowl though. Not sure if I'll be back to be honest.

VOYw0P1BiFagWqlhPI3YdA.text: Best healthy fast food around!!  Everything is delicious and everyone that works there are nice.  Love coming here for lunch.

PmKyL4eLUPniy6e2WCgO9A.text: Just in here for lunch today... my cashier seemed like she didn't want to be there at all and had a horrible mood! They manager walked by me.. so I said hello and he walked right past me like I wasn't even there. So did the lady the handed me my food. Kinda rude never going back to this location.

a1aEe6_ljdCFtv8wokxIQA.text: Love this place! Great chicken dishes & best French fries I have ever had! Green beans are a great side there as well. We really like the rice bowls as well. A bit crowded sometimes & parking is terrible, but that's True of most of the Waverly complex.

HoY8ikJcE3eG2D3f1zs89w.text: Ok this place was so good. the order taker was very nice and helped me with all of my questions. then, the food came out mighty fast as well. everything was clean except for a little fluid on the counter ad the drink station, which can't be expected to be cleaned all the time with this many customers, which I understand and I'm find with. the station to get sauce by the window was extraordinarily clean as well. also, when I was through with my meal, Iowa's about to go get more water, and a man actually was coming around with water and filled me up. THEN, I went to go to bathroom and throw away my food, and someone else took that too! overall an excellent experience, 5 stars!

9ekGUWfUBY3-NH_XRygOtg.text: I continue to be impressed with the Viva Chicken team!!Their food is delicious and keto friendly (think quinoa avocado minus quinoa add chicken). They are well organized with catering from ordering to pick up. The food is well packaged. They thank you for your business! And best of all their support our local community!   P.S. Viva Chicken thank you for your support of the 2018 Charlotte LUNGe Forward 5K, Walk & Rally! May 19th at Park Road Park

DCV89c1NDPhnEiLIpmDmiA.text: This place is amazing. The food is always top notch and the service is the best. We were waiting for a to-go order and some nice young man came over and asked us if we would like some water. You have to try the plantains - they are the best:)

LXz9Hyqjuz6sgKmiyAhWxQ.text: Shout out to Daniel one of the managers. Best salads and great cookies.  We enjoyed our dinner and the  service is great.   We will be back soon for more delicious food.

xiGnA_nuOiOl4Bqcbh2AVw.text: Well just took the plunge! We were not disappointed. First I have never had Peruvian food before. My wife and I didn't know what to order. The staff was helpful. Lots of options for both meat eaters and vegetarians. The food was flavorful. I like putting sauces on everything, but didn't want to because it didn't need it. My wife loved her wrap. We can't wait to go back and try something different.

1wnCTc-nsHSdNyFR8Wp-fQ.text: Absolutely incredible restaurant, great atmosphere service and prices. The chicken is so good!! I just wish we had them back home in St. Louis! I will definitely be coming back every time I'm in Charlotte.

qFOhjZalq4FiNHry-KwfDA.text: I'm only doing this for a couple of reasons :  this is one of my favorite Peruvian rotisserie chicken restaurants and I would hate to see it getting sloppy and because I leave so close I order and eat there often, hope this helps improve. We decided to order out this time, it's cold out we are watching the Saints loose the division game (shamelessly) and we didn't feel like going anywhere. Well, my chicken was undercooked, a bit bloody near the bone  very disappointed because i didn't want to go back out to restaurant and bring it back and face that Waverley traffic that is getting worst by the minute and I'm pretty sure I just got a bit of a stomachache. This place is great in service and I've never gotten bad food before, I can see it's always busy, has become one of the most popular places in the new park. If you read this please keep an eye on your food quality you don't want to risk clientele or even worse get people sick.  1/15 Update :  I was contacted by Viva Chicken with an apology for my experience, this speaks loud of their excellent service and will to continue being one of he best, thanks for listening to your customers :) I will continue going to your restaurant and invite all to try their food if you haven't yet.

KtCuwxkXGYEdP6P5pAcYFQ.text: First time at Viva Chicken. This was some of the best chicken I've had. Different kind of spices - not too hot, well balanced. Great flavor, cooked perfectly. Plantains and Cilantro rice was great. Don't miss some of the special sauces (but watch out for the hot one!)  Service was good, staff was friendly and helpful for us first timers.

4sIXg2-XS1-pN6W8UEs95w.text: Excellent food with good value.  Use their pick-up / take out service a lot and pre-orders are usually accurate (95%). Tremendous salads (all of them) and like the wraps.  Would like to see more grain & wheat free options on the wraps.

YW0AjdU6PQHcqwLEmSQJhQ.text: They should rename Viva Chicken to Viva Fries. Without question, the best fries on the planet. Don't believe me- go there and try not to weep softly while you eat them. The chicken is good too, but you will know who the star is when you eat a fry.

2umW2Av8gUNjVaz9-6eUCg.text: Delicious food but disappointed they have NO nutritional information. When you have special diet restrictions it's helpful to know nutritional info. Also, NO WiFi

ha5SdW5zO3ID9nzFGd7VGg.text: Great place for a casual dinner with the family. Chicken offerings are great, love the sauces, love the friendly service. Viva Chicken!

zfmHvC-kNsp8W_bfk9oaJg.text: This was my favorite place that I frequent every time I'm in Charlotte especially because I'm moving to the area.  However noticed the service is horrific.. cashier left me sitting at the counter without welcoming or acknowledging me for 10 minutes while someone ran out to their car.  Need to find another place in Waverly now due to the bad service here.  Very unfortunate:(!

Ykmf8apP5qzp2h7cQtXZQg.text: This is the perfect place to go if you want something wholesome without having to cook yourself, the food is flavorful and health-friendly. i really liked how they had several healthy options to choose from. I decided to go with 4 stars because the customer service was a little unpleasant at this location.

7BkHMn6eZhQz6Z-ie5_0aQ.text: The goal is business and not customer satisfaction. Unhelpful staff and if you finish your meal, they ask you to leave quickly.

hKKYDzQgHFyBC7BZjNjzlg.text: Have been a regular to Viva Chicken but this was my first time at their new Waverly location.  Since it was a new location, the wife and I decided to break away from our regular stuffed avocado and saltado order.    I got the tacu bowl with chicken, and it was outstanding.  Really important to order this with the cilantro infused rice as it adds a nice layer.  The pickled onions on top were a perfect sour note to counter the 'red sauce' that I could eat with anything...I was a happy camper.    The wife ordered the 1/4 chicken, but the star of the show was the solterito side. It had two kinds of beans, feta cheese, pickled onions and fresh tomatoes... Super fresh.    For the first time, we got the Tres Leches, and while it cream soaked sponge cake with a marshmallow frosting (sooo good) it was actually light.  The denseness that usually comes with a dessert was not there.    As for the location, I am so happy I don't have to drive to Johnston Rd now.  There is plenty of parking, and after dinner, we were able to walk around Waverly and grabbed a drink next door.

rg5CD5kxpq9gf9Awk7ppPw.text: One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Charlotte. I have been to every location in town with the exception of Huntersville and the quality here is consistent with all of the other locations, which is something many other restaurants struggle with. Viva Chicken is one of those places you eat at and you don't feel crappy after! The freshness is evident and I would say most, if not all, of their menu items can appeal to someone who is health conscious or has food allergies. I am super stoked to have another Viva Chicken in the area--awesome work and awesome concept!

CslcLPfIhtpaXizruTbg_A.text: I was really excited to try this place! We ordered some Arroz Chufa (chicken and rice) and some different wraps to share. I enjoyed all of them! The food is fresh, great quality, and has a lot of flavor. I tried the yellow sauce with the Arroz Chufa and would recommend it, but they have other options too. I can't wait to come back and try the Quinoa Stuffed Avocado!

SS6OrbWbt6DE1hQmFVb6Wg.text: Just newly opened in Waverly this Viva Chicken location does not disappoint! The dinning room and patio offer lots of seating.... But seriously you came here to eat that delicious chicken.     Like the other locations the menu is the same and all the sauces are there should you decide to need them. The chicken is delicious and the rice - both jasmine and cilantro infused are both yummy.   The new Waverly location is noisy . The background music is loud and the ceilings are high which adds even more noise than you'd expect .    Great food - excellent service ! Way to go Viva Chicken !

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. New location at Waverly Shopping center !  Yippie
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious 1/4 white with cilantro rice &amp; canary beans !

dNiEkJc5bv07Jf5lBoaPVw.text: Super impressed!  The food was delicious and plenty of it!  The staff is on top of making sure plates are cleaned from your table and bring you anything you need.   Very pleasant experience and we will be coming back!  Perfectly cooked chicken--YUM

XUw_gQIJDk_4SElv8wwiuQ.text: As far as "fast food" this place is great! The customer service is so awesome! I ordered directly from my phone app ...I literally walked in 5 minutes later and my order was ready!! Super easy and awesome for moms on the go who want something fairly healthy! I LOVE the Peruvian corn salad and the rice, beans and avocado! Great for vegetarians

SlL6GEw6f0lr94gXwb5feA.text: The absolute best deal is the "Whole chicken + 3 large sides" ($23.95). It's enough to feed a family of 4 or 5. As our side items, I ordered Yuca Fries, Green Beans, and the Solterito Salad (edamame, corn). I love the Aji Amarillo Sauce -- it goes fantastic with everything. The Huancaina Sauce (creamy queso fresco) is aight -- it comes with the Yuca Fries, but isn't as flavorful as the yellow sauce. The Cup of Quinoa Side ($3.75) is not worth its price. It is barely a cup's worth and is on top of some lettuce/romaine. The Yuca Fries are the BEST I've ever had at any restaurant -- crispy all over, with a melt in your mouth inside. The rotisserie chicken is the all-star item that brings all the boys (and girls) to the yard -- it's perfectly seasoned, juicy, and delicious. The Quinoa Avocado is fantastic ($6.95) and if you add chicken ($2.45), it's a meal in itself, as it has organic quinoa, red pepper, rocoto mayo, balsamic vinaigrette. The Arroz Chaufa ($6.95) is Peruvian take on Asian fried rice, but with red peppers, green onions, eggs, ginger, and Peruvian soy sauce. I absolutely love this place -- and there is a reason that the line is always long!

ocFgtVDYDS4e9zNYXRqevQ.text: Amazing food I especially love the stuffed avocado with Chicken. The service is also great and the extra sauce, it's all soo good

Ldr7oDWtjOq2JPx4cv2CTA.text: Arroz Chufa is basically the best thing ever. Everything is delicious and a good price but I definitely get arroz chufa (fried rice) with chicken almost every single time. They have different sauces you can try, but my favorite is the yellow one. It's so good with the fried rice. They are usually pretty fast and have plenty of seating-- though we usually get it to go. One order of fried rice feeds two adults easily. I tried a few of their speciality drinks once and didn't really like them, so I would try them before you purchase. This is one of our regular go-tos when I don't want to make dinner.

YnhZROZcbrkuXFqRqkafhQ.text: The lunch I had today at the new Waverly location was terrific.   I chose a Cobb salad that had the freshest ingredients, including golden raisins, avocado, the hugest kernels of corn I have ever seen, and roasted pulled Peruvian chicken.  Although I have dined at other Viva locations, this was my favorite experience so far. The food just tasted so FRESH!   We sat outside on the patio in perfect autumn weather.  Everyone who worked there was super friendly, almost unbelievably so.  Oh, don't forget to get a side of the yuca.   The world needs more yuca!   Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quarter roasted chicken with yuca fries
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb salad with unique fresh ingredients

PjGX2rj_BwM-e7yvuogLHg.text: Don't get me wrong the food is great! But the service just sucks. It was our first time trying Viva Chicken and we were really excited. We ordered and everything was smooth until our order. We got home excited to try it and opened the box and IT WAS THE WRONG ORDER. It was missing items that we had ordered. Good thing we only live a short drive away so we could go back and get it fixed. We went in and the lady that works there she said she will give us the items that were missing but she cannot make it fresh. What really got me is how another lady came up saying her order was late and the lady who was helping us ended up giving her gift cards meanwhile we stood there with our order wrong and she gave us an attitude. It has me wondering why she didn't give us anything to make up for the terrible service.

gaS2hlRpIhM88kEHNMsDig.text: Best Peruvian chicken I've ever had. Meat falls right off the bone. Yucca was ok. Plantains were good. Green beans were too salty for my preference. I love this place!

C6tzKXhMWXXeEmPkaNXWng.text: Absolutely love this place! Amazing customer service and always prompt even when they are crowded! Great food and great service!

jVxwd9HqFGrUVoVobx-L7w.text: Always consistent! It's a chain I know but it's still so good. New spot in Waverly. Parking sucks in the Plaza but there's a lot of restaurants so it is to be expected

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken with cilantro rice and green beans

wHsJ20TCdNxvMNn5y_obsw.text: Viva Chicken is going to take over Charlotte. It is amazing food. Tonight I got the 1/2 chicken and 2 sides. The chicken is phenomenal. Always tastes pretty fresh. It's not dry and the seasoning is great. The red and green sauces are my go to but don't forget the yellow. The yellow sauce is a good lighter heat with a honey mustard twang. I got cilantro rice as one of my sides... It is incredible. Seriously some of the best rice I have ever had. For my second side I chose the green beans to balance out the meal. I like the green beans because they don't turn into mush but have a good crunch and are a great combo with the rice and chicken. My fiancee and I definitely frequent this Viva chicken quite often. We honestly wanted Italian and instead we went here so it's pretty damn good.

yXtAYDXkBAMzoKB4X0QTQg.text: I love Viva Chicken! The food is fantastic, the people are nice and accommodating, the location could not be easier to get to.   But the music?  The music at the this location is HORRIBLE! Whoever picked this music for your casual dining pleasure should be fired and run out of town. Loud, abusive, with a driving beat that WILL NOT allow you to enjoy your meal or the friends you are there with. It's invasive and raises both your anxiety level and your blood pressure.  Makes you want to either rip your ears off so you don't have to be subjected to that raucousness or to take you food to go.  Looks like the Johnson Road location will now be our go to. Too bad. It's in such a great location and in the middle of a lifestyle center that will thrive and grow. Won't be long before it's replaced by another restaurant at this rate. (Or they'll get rid of the manager who was in the building the entire time we were there.)  And did I mention that the choice of music and volume is horrible?

1bAxT77KWujo35TukyYdhg.text: I'm sitting in Viva Chicken in Waverly RIGHT NOW!  Although the food is good, the service was TERRIBLE!!  I won't be back!

2sihN7ReWv6gZJhEiwzPUw.text: The food here is absolutely amazing. The entire staff is friendly. Online ordering ahead is available and easy. Very cool atmosphere. And extremely reasonably priced. Again, I can't stress how delicious the food and especially the sauces are. I try to make it at least once a week and always go for the Tacu Bowl. It's so good I haven't been tempted to try anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States

HO3WbxKBtb-msWXOyF0hrQ.text: I used the order online and take out feature. I ordered from the parking lot across the street (Lifetime) and selected the 7:30 pick up window. I was there to pick up my food by 7:23pm and it was ready! The chicken wrap and sweet potato fries were absolutely delicious. Everything was hot and fresh. For a special treat, don't forget your special sauce!

pVSLGEOJZKU_9-MZm9uPcw.text: I LOVE Viva Chicken and used to drive to Elizabeth a few times a month to eat there...well the drive is over. Now I have one right next door. I haven't ventured far from my favorite dish, 1/4 white with green beans and side salad. But that alone is reason enough for me to return time after time.  As boring as this meal may sound to some it truly hits the spot and keeps me CLOSE to my healthy eating plans.  I love to double dip my chicken into the yellow mild, then the green medium and a drop of red to top it off. The green sauce is perfect as the salad dressing giving it a mildly spicy kick that won't burn your buds. But the real deal is to top the green beans with just a touch of the mild yellow and VOILA...its the perfect amount of flavor and a TINY bit of heat.

87fF37II9QT5J-VGCj90Qg.text: Viva chicken is consistently beautiful fresh ingredients combined with interesting flavors and great chicken. What more do you need?? My favorites are the stuffed avocado- secret- you can get half and add chicken and it's prefect size for me. The stuffed avocado is literally a full half of avocado filled with quinoa and then I add the chicken and it has 2 sauces that go on top.. I love them both. Gosh I love that, but their chicken soup is my favorite ANYWHERE. Just such a clean broth and fresh herbs on top.. so good. They have specialty sauces at the back of the restaurant but they're all too spicy for me, I just request more of the brown sauce, I think it's a vinaigrette. Don't forget the juices when you order. They make 3 in house daily all fresh marinated with fruits and herbs, you can't go wrong. So excited I have one so close now!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing Cobb salad!
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half order of stuffed avocado plus chicken... get it!!

WvKTPqmJxuvR18ie9K8eaQ.text: This place is awesome the bowls are delicious and I would recommend it to anyone, cool atmosphere with outdoor seating. We will definitely be coming back.

maSe4IpNaFghznNlZ64zYg.text: We've eaten there many times, always love it.  However, this review is specific to their catering service. We used Viva for our son's grad party and it was a massive success. We easily fed 115 people, and EVERYONE was happy with it. They even made some of the stuffed avocados vegan to accommodate some of our guests! If you need to cater an event, don't hesitate to work with Viva. Thanks!

AZIbvQaQderqBcGqGD_fdA.text: I ordered the 1/2 chicken with yuca and house salad. Chicken was juicy and had great flavor. I normally don't eat that much chicken in a sitting, but I just wanted to clean my plate.   They offer 3 sauces here: a yellow aji amarillo sauce, a green cilantro-y flavored huacatay sauce, and a red rocoto sauce. I liked dipping my chicken best in the red sauce. Added a nice spice.   My friends had sweet potato fries that I got to try too. They're great to dip in the sauces. Same with the yuca. I wish I was given more in my serving haha. They're hard to make and made well here.   The salad was ordinary. A green salad with red onion, tomato, feta, cucumber, and maybe some kale with a balsamic dressing.   I'd def come back. Food came out moderately quick.

d6lY14WNLErOihUds_ORnw.text: Viva has some of the best rotisserie chicken in the game. The use of spices makes for a pretty tasty bird. I like that they always have a great selection of side to choose from. My favorite ones are the cilantro rice and the plantains. The service is good as well and they had my food ready in about 3 minutes today. It's a great option if you want something that is fresh and tasty. I hope you enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 rotisserie chicken with cilantro rice and plantains.

XnD1CvZ3RZ604eD_nciU9A.text: I will always give Viva Chicken a 5-star review!! Their food is delicious, fresh, and unique! My favorite is the pulled chicken with French fries and green beans.  They have the best fries and they're ALWAYS hot and fresh! I highly recommend them...but I also recommend just getting a large order of them. You won't regret it!!

REQTf8PG7kUJLmLKRvdI9A.text: I'm literally writing this review while I eat!  I'm a longtime fan of Vida, but THIS meal is knocking my socks off!  The Peruvian chicken is perfectly cooked--so tender, so juicy. The seasonings bring out the wonderful flavor to the chicken so much so that you won't need or want to add one of their amazing sauces. YUM!  And the sides as well. Yuca can be a little tough or chewy, but not today. It is fried perfectly crisp on the outside while somehow still being soft on the inside.  The plantains are caramelized and sweet. And the rice is also perfectly cooked and seasoned. I would have liked a warmer greeting while ordering, but I did finally get my cashier to smile by complimenting her cat eyeliner, which totally rocked, but has nothing to do with my review.  So all in all, WTG Viva-Waverly. You are my fav in this chain!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken all white meat, cilantro lime rice, yuca.
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken all white meat, cilantro lime rice, plantains.
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their sauces are amazing. I&#39;m #teamgreen.

lAOVe1ZHWJN791YooqZ5Xg.text: I went here last week with my brother, and I had no idea what to expect! When you walk in, you go to the counter and order your meal, and then you get a number and they'll bring it out to you. There are so many things to choose from. The salads that I saw looked huge and delicious, as do the sandwiches! My brother said that he always gets 1/4 chicken with two sides, and since that sounded tasty, I decided to follow suit. (Especially since this way I could try two sides, and we all know the sides are the best part-Am I right??)   After we ordered we were lucky enough to find a table. It was hoppin' busy at 7:30pm on a Friday night! Which, I take as a very good sign. Once you've claimed your table, you can go up to the common area to get silverware, napkins, and sauces. There are three types of sauces. One has a red sign, and is hot, so I didn't even try it. Ha! One has a green sign, and it has a lot of herbs in there, maybe cilantro. That one was okay. The last sauce has a yellow sign, and it was good. Definitely the most mild sauce they have, almost more of a creamy sauce.   Then we waited, it did take a few minutes longer for the food to arrive than I would've thought, but like I said, they were busy. The food was really good, and I feel like I got a good size portion for the price. The chicken had a lot of seasoning on it, definitely more than just salt and pepper! There are some other herbs there, and it gives it more of a Mediterranean feel. The chicken had a good skin, and my piece was fairly juicy. My cilantro rice was very good! It had good flavor. Lastly, the plantains. I'm a sucker for plantains, because I never see them anywhere. My order came with maybe 4 of them, and they were warm and big and juicy, and just perfection! I will definitely be back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delivery car!
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken with cilantro rice and plantains
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sauces

-4wEPa9B9VTxNP9eV5_TRA.text: This place has become one of our favorites. The menu is filled with healthy options. My usual is the Tacu Bowl, which is rice topped with pulled rotisserie chicken, cilantro, avocado and other great stuff.  Three delicious sauces are available self-serve, but be warned, the hot is indeed HOT. The dining room is festive but maybe a bit too loud for some. Service is consistently friendly and attentive, and sanitation score is typically in the high 90's. Have only had good experiences here.

aEBJEST9OFABPwgTnof8CQ.text: Viva chicken is my go to place to eat service is always good and food  quality is consistent there sauces are always good to have with chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States

v9at7NTvDSWiL_Qr9PsE1A.text: The Viva Chicken at 11641 Waverly Center Dr is very nice. Good environment and nice staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States

2xeuzyjjgapbN7gcrE3caA.text: I love viva chicken but this location only the portion of food is very small for what you pay, especially when carrying out. So disappointing because the food is amazing. The Sun Valley location is by far amazing and you get your money's worth!  After I mixed my salad together...barely anything in there

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States

7MzqFdisP9WEYUb_Txk5hA.text: Excellent chicken dishes! I enjoyed the arroz con pollo--chicken and fried rice dish and the Chicken Tacu bowl--rice and chicken with avocado. The sauces are amazing! I like the yellow garlic sauce the most!! Try them all when dining inside the restaurant. The chicken is tender and juicy and delicious roasted Peruvian style!! The drinks with fruit are amazing too if you like sweet delicious flavors.

APDi0Vm7ROZ2FjBJBF7wnA.text: This was my first visit to a Viva Chicken and i was really impressed! The restaurant was very clean and its evident as soon as you enter that you are gonna have a great, fresh meal.  The staff is also very pleasant and helpful as you navigate the menu.  I ordered the Sopa de Pollo (chicken soup) and it was fantastic! It comes topped with an amazing assortment of fresh veggies and is very filling.  No noodles,  just a lot of chicken with rice.  I also had the Yucca Fries side. Comes with 8 fries and a delicious dipping sauce.  Definitely a delight.  Crisp and light and a perfect side dish.  I would also suggest getting the Herbal Limeade.   It's different from other limeades but oh so delicious.  The mint flavore comes through and is so thirst quenching!   I'll definitely be returning to try and review additional items!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sopa de Pollo

SjgLcJqBvWyf1-RfKbwD1w.text: Consistently so good. Manager is a friendly dude with a good attitude in what is a busy place.   My boys are pleading for them to bring back the chicken strips kids meal!

jHlcztMw2Lt7dfJKOZBkog.text: Viva Chicken is our new favorite fast-service restaurant. Everything that we have eaten here has been fresh and delicious. The rice is always perfect texture and the chicken is always moist and delicious. Toppings are always bright and fresh and the prices are very reasonable, especially for the quality.  Their housemade sauces are excellent as well. Sangria is my favorite. It packs a punch and is always topped with delicious fresh fruit (apples, oranges, pineapple, etc).  Service is always super friendly and the restaurant is consistently spotless.

NBxwMQuMhlo_UkcAr-BrNA.text: Viva Chicken Limena Chopped Salad, lime passion fruit dressing w.steak. An ONLINE, pickup order, which I then called to clarify the chickpeas were not breaded & fried bc I am gluten sensitive, and I did not want red onions. She said none of that is in the dish. Super! Fresh chopped kale & romaine (they had me right there!) topped with edamame,  Peruvian corn, (?)baked chickpeas, bacon, a diced tomato mixture & queso. The dressing was a refreshing blend of sweet fruit and acidic citrus that mixed well with the ingredients..... Ingredients which DID have diced red onions. Im guessing in the tomato mixture, which is not listed as an ingredient. Oh well, everything else was delicious. I'm thinking, the next time I will ask how the chickpeas are crisped!:- / Service is so expeditious they even have baggies individually, hand-rolled where to put the sauce cups! This place is one well-oiled machine that pays attention to details!  Yes, one mistake tonight, which could be serious if I was allergic. Thankfully, I am not; it's just a preference. And, I'm confident all of the staff will now know every ingredient (or ask) & their menu will be updated.  Still gives me a comfy, fulfilling feeling every time I come. Everything has always been fresh! Also bc I am somewhat a clean-phobe and this place sparkles!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States

3Ktaw7pnv7HNJSTuK-uCXw.text: I love the Arroz Chaufa. The chicken is tender and a good proportion to the fresh rice. All of the vegetables are fresh. They have three sauces that you serve yourself that I don't know the names of, but I love the yellow and green. Yellow is the mildest. They both add good flavor to the rice dish. The Herbal Limeade is refreshing and different, with the hints of mint, basil, and rosemary.

ivaQc0qWhrgtwz2YlHONkA.text: I've been to Viva Chicken several times but this was my first time at this location. We came around 11:15 am and they weren't busy at all. I'm sure if it got closer to 12 it would be packed. We ordered right away and got a booth by the window.   I got the 1/4 chicken with the rice and soup. The chicken was so tender and fall off the bone. The rice adds a nice touch to it. I was so full by then I took my soup home. The soup is my favorite part. It's so flavorful and perfect for a cold night!!   Service was good and the restaurant was super clean!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken with rice and soup

1S8iw9uN4I3iRU08J8mbRg.text: Viva is a good place to have lunch.  The new space at Waverly is very large and spacious.  There are many windows all around to let in a lot of natural light.  It's very clean, fresh, and new.  The staff is extremely  nice and even come around filling up drinks and taking trash.  They obviously don't have to and not a lot of places like this do, but it's a nice added touch.  It makes one feel welcome.  Plus you can also tell they work hard.    The food is good like always.  I like the stuffed avocado and of course all the sauces-yum!  This particular location has a large shared lot for parking and it's not really hard to get a spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States

yJhw1iKnW2QYieuihQ2EeA.text: One of our go-to dinner spots. Absolutely delicious,  chill atmosphere, and amazing service! I always get the 1/4 chicken and it's always moist with lots of flavor! My husband likes to get the wraps (great wrap is his favorite) and they are always pretty generous in size.   This is a good spot to come to with a group, or to get takeout, or even come to on a date. Technically it's fast casual, but the servers constantly come around to check on you and get you refills, so it feels like a more upscale restaurant. We usually sit out in the terrace, and the manager will even come check on us and ask if we need the music down or the heater on. It really feels like a cheers-type restaurant even though it's a chain. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great wrap with fries
Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 chicken with fries and plantains

t5FMa5qDqJuvOTfDC_DNrw.text: This was my first time at Viva Chicken, and it was a good experience. Our order was taken immediately by friendly staff,  who knew the menu well. The dining area was clean and well stocked with napkins,  utensils, etc. I got the chicken tacu bowl with cilantro rice, which included juicy chicken, canary beans, along with the cilantro rice, avocado,  and pickled red onion. The only downside was that the chef was heavy handed with the red onion, which I didn't like, but I just removed them and everything was good.  I also had the herbal limeade to drink , which was a little cilantro forward for me, but I tasted the passionfruit juice, which was soo good. Lastly, I wanted to try a churro, and it was warm and sweet and worth the money considering it was 10 inches long. I'll definitely  be back to try some other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Chicken - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 Chicken tacu bowls with cilantro rice, herbal limeade and passionfruit juice , as well as 2 churros and the 3 famous sauces
